artist: Author: Elijah Coleman Bridgman; Collaborator: Guiding marks by Mitsukuri Genpo; Publisher: Yorozuya Heishirō; Carver: Takeguchi Rōsaburō
catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 496
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: orderly columns of clearly printed characters; color images of world maps and United States maps; images of Western boats and vehicles, buildings, and farm animals; textured yellow cover
markings: Japanese inscription in red, R on front cover; pencil markings URC first page; stamp inside front cover LLC
medium: Woodblock printed book; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Brief Account of the United States (Renpō shiryaku 聯邦志略)
text: This is a Japanese reprint of a Chinese book written by the American missionary Elijah C. Bridgman and published in Shanghai in 1861. It is the first, thorough account of the United States written by an American that was published in Japan. The first volume provides a general survey including culture, education, transportation, and an introduction to the constitution and the Supreme Court. The second volume focusses on individual states, illustrating a number of small local maps.
title: Brief Account of the United States, vol. 1
